intro: Octomeria spicata, commonly known as the spiky octomeria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, spiny capsules that contain seeds. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. Octomeria spicata is typically found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to withstand arid conditions.
